pagination_799fb5780c1b0529974833d162117: The process of pagination takes place when we need to present big groups of arbitrary data gradually. Phalcon\\Paginator offers a fast and convenient way to split these sets of data browsable pages.
pagination_0a355558f3d14bbc0f7654611acd1: This component makes use of adapters to encapsulate different sources of data:
pagination_7c4638677d770640bb9b67cfd532d: In the example below, the paginator will use as its source data the result of a query from a model, and limit the displayed data to 10 records per page:
pagination_8df2863da0e367967d74af7b16381: In a controller this can be:
pagination_baa3cc342b3b7c5519509d895fff0: Create a Model paginator, show 10 rows by page starting from $currentPage
pagination_0dda7a9eb9896cd0d29e6cdc6aa5c: Variable $currentPage controls the page to be displayed. The $paginator->getPaginate() returns a $page object that contains the paginated data. It can be used for generating the pagination:
